title: Mass velocity of two sliding block system

content.question: Two identical blocks slide along a ramp with negligible friction, as shown. The first block has an initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> up the ramp while the second has the same initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> down the ramp. The coordinate system shown defines down the ramp to be the positive <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> direction. While both blocks are sliding on the ramp, the center of mass velocity of the two-block system is

choices.label: increasing in the <math alttext="negative x" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math> direction
increasing in the <math alttext="positive x" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math> direction

content.answer: increasing in the <math alttext="positive x" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math> direction
